pardon.translation[0].definitions[0].def: used when you want someone to repeat something because you did not hear it
pardon.translation[0].definitions[1].def: used to say ‘sorry’ after you have made an impolite sound such as a burp
pardon.translation[1].definitions[0].def: to officially allow someone who has been found guilty of a crime to go free without being punished
pardon.translation[1].definitions[0].exa: The two spies were pardoned yesterday by the president.
pardon.translation[1].definitions[1].def: to forgive someone for behaving badly
pardon.translation[1].definitions[1].exa: He could never pardon her for the things she had said.
pardon.translation[2].definitions[0].def: an official order allowing someone who has been found guilty of a crime to go free without being punished
pardon.translation[2].definitions[0].exa: Tyler was convicted but was granted a royal pardon  (=one given by a king or queen).
